metadata.Title: CVE-2022-38476 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description: A data race could occur in the PK11_ChangePW function, potentially leading to a use-after-free vulnerability. In Firefox, this lock protected the data when a user changed their master password. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 102.2 and Thunderbird < 102.2. Update Instructions: Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-38476` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: thunderbird - 1:102.2.2+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:102.2.2+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:102.2.2+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:102.2.2+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:102.2.2+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 xul-ext-lightning - 1:102.2.2+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 No subscription required

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:102.2.2+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
